title: [Large-Scale] Constructivist Mathematics Instructional Design: Application of the Negotiation Hierarchy Model (Focus on Equations, Graphs, and Problem Solving)

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic mathematics pedagogy and constructivist theory, LMS (Learning Management System) experience, mastery of core secondary mathematics concepts (equations, functions, geometry), and fundamental computational skills
context.additional_context: Cultivating competencies for pre-service teachers to effectively apply constructivist approaches in elementary and secondary mathematics classroomsâ€”particularly emphasizing mathematical modeling for real-life problem-solving, graph interpretation, and statistical analysis activities.

learning_goals: Learners will design math lessons that strengthen equation, graph, and statistical problem-solving skills by applying a constructivist theory-based instructional design framework through a negotiation hierarchy model

Learners will develop multi-layered interactive math instructional materials reflecting learner-teacher-content dynamics through three or more design phases (analysis, design, implementation) and integrate formal applications and problem-solving strategies at each stage

Learners will design and operate online math learning environments enabling collaborative knowledge construction using digital tools (GeoGebra, Desmos, etc.), incorporating graph visualization and probability modeling activities
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
